item.title: Slack Introduces New Platform With Help From Deno
item.content:encoded: Today Slack has announced their next generation development platform. Slack chose Deno for its "secure by default" principles, its web standard APIs, and its first-class TypeScript support.

item.title: Connecting to Postgres from the edge
item.content:encoded: Many serverless at edge products can not connect to Postgres because they don't support TCP. Deno Deploy can.

item.title: Deno 1.16 Release Notes
item.content:encoded: Deno 1.16 adds support for new JSX transforms, reading files from disk using fetch, and much more.

item.title: Deno Deploy Beta 3
item.content:encoded: Deno Deploy is a multi-tenant distributed JavaScript VM running in 28 data centers across the world.

item.title: Deno 1.15 Release Notes
item.content:encoded: Deno 1.15 improves Web Crypto support, adds deno uninstall subcommand, stabilizes URLPattern and more.

item.title: September 23 incident update
item.content:encoded: Post-mortem report for the 35 minute service outage on on September 23, 2021.

item.title: Deno 1.14 Release Notes
item.content:encoded: Deno 1.14 improves Web Crypto support, adds customization options to deno fmt and deno lint, introduces URLPattern, and more.

item.title: Deno Deploy Beta 2
item.content:encoded: Deno Deploy is a multi-tenant distributed JavaScript VM running in 25 data centers across the world.

item.title: Deno on MDN
item.content:encoded: Web compatibility data for Deno is now available on MDN.

item.title: Deno 1.13 Release Notes
item.content:encoded: Deno 1.13 stabilizes the native HTTP server, and introduces FFI, a streaming WebSocket API, the new self.structuredClone() function and more.

item.title: July 27 incident update
item.content:encoded: Post-mortem report for the 6 minute service outage on July 27, 2021.

item.title: Deno 1.12 Release Notes
item.content:encoded: The Deno 1.12 release adds server side WebSockets, support for WASM threads, new web crypto APIs and more.

item.title: Deno Deploy Beta 1
item.content:encoded: Deno Deploy is a multi-tenant distributed JavaScript VM running in 25 data centers across the world.

item.title: Deno 1.11 Release Notes
item.content:encoded: The Deno 1.11 release adds new web APIs, resolves long standing issues, and improves editor experience.

item.title: Deno 1.10 Release Notes
item.content:encoded: Deno 1.10 improves the built-in test runner, adds support for Web Storage API, structured clone, and more.

item.title: Deno 1.9 Release Notes
item.content:encoded: Deno 1.9 adds a new native HTTP/2 web server, a vastly improved op infrastructure, import completions in the LSP, an interactive permission prompt, blob url support.

item.title: Announcing the Deno Company
item.content:encoded: We have raised money to enable the millions of web programmers out there to maximally leverage their craft.

item.title: March 2 incident update
item.content:encoded: Post-mortem report for the 98 minute service outage on March 2, 2021.

item.title: Deno 1.8 Release Notes
item.content:encoded: Deno 1.8 adds experimental support for the WebGPU API, adds support for importing private modules, stabilizes import maps, revamps coverage tooling, adds ICU to provide internationalization out of the box, and a whole lot more.

item.title: Deno 1.7 Release Notes
item.content:encoded: Deno 1.7, one of our largest releases to date, adds cross compilation and 60% smaller binaries for deno compile, a DNS resolver API, support for data URLs in import statements and web workers, and much more.

item.title: Deno in 2020
item.content:encoded: Retrospect of what happened in Deno in 2020

item.title: Deno 1.6 Release Notes
item.content:encoded: Deno 1.6 adds the abilty to build your Deno projects into fully standalone, self-contained executables with `deno compile`. The release also introduces a built-in LSP for editor integrations, and experimental Apple Silicon support.

item.title: Deno 1.5 Release Notes
item.content:encoded: Deno 1.5 improves `deno bundle` with support for tree shaking and a 15x speed improvement. This release also adds the `alert`, `confirm`, and `prompt` APIs and enhances the REPL.

item.title: Deno 1.4 Release Notes
item.content:encoded: Deno 1.4 adds support for the web standard WebSocket API, deno run --watch, and integrated test coverage. This is the largest feature release yet.

item.title: Updates to deno.land/x
item.content:encoded: Design considerations and changes for the new code hosting service.

item.title: Deno 1.0
item.content:encoded: Dynamic languages are useful tools. Scripting allows users to rapidly and succinctly tie together complex systems and express ideas without worrying about details like memory management or build systems.
